pullRequest.body:
#18615 adds non-unital versions of the `elemental` (star) algebras: i.e., the topological closure of the algebra generated by a single element.

That PR develops a series of standard lemmas and uniform naming practices. This PR adapts the existing unital `elemental` algebras to the naming convention and adjusts the existing lemmas to match API.

---

Note: this is independent of #18615

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [ab3588439b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18664/commits/ab3588439b984d2e2b91cd1cdf48a533f06d9589)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.elemental`
`+ _root_.Algebra.self_mem_elementalAlgebra`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.bijective_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.characterSpaceHomeo`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.closedEmbedding_coe`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.continuous_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.induction_on`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.isClosed`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.isClosedEmbedding_coe`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.le_of_isClosed_of_mem`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.self_mem`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.starAlgHomClass_ext`
`+ _root_.elementalStarAlgebra.star_self_mem`
`+ bijective_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ characterSpaceHomeo`
`+ characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ continuous_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`+ elemental`
`+ instance (a : A) [IsStarNormal a] : CommCStarAlgebra (elemental ℂ a)`
`+ instance [T2Space A] {x : A} : CommRing (elemental R x)`
`+ instance [T2Space A] {x : A} : CommSemiring (elemental R x)`
`+ instance [T2Space A] {x : A} [IsStarNormal x] : CommSemiring (elemental R x)`
`+ instance {A : Type*} [UniformSpace A] [CompleteSpace A] [Semiring A]`
`++ le_iff_mem`
`++ le_of_mem`
`++- isClosed`
`++- isClosedEmbedding_coe`
`++- self_mem`
`- Algebra.self_mem_elementalAlgebra`
`- closedEmbedding_coe`
`- elementalStarAlgebra`
`- elementalStarAlgebra.bijective_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`- elementalStarAlgebra.characterSpaceHomeo`
`- elementalStarAlgebra.characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`- elementalStarAlgebra.continuous_characterSpaceToSpectrum`
`- instance (a : A) [IsStarNormal a] : CommCStarAlgebra (elementalStarAlgebra ℂ a)`
`- instance [T2Space A] {x : A} : CommRing (Algebra.elementalAlgebra R x)`
`- instance [T2Space A] {x : A} [IsStarNormal x] : CommSemiring (elementalStarAlgebra R x)`
`- le_of_isClosed_of_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11733290791/job/32687239978)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11733290791/job/32687240286)
Could you also add the `iff` statement ? These tend to be very useful when rewriting.

I'm a bit scared by the fact that [Subalgebra.commSemiringTopologicalClosure](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Algebra.html#Subalgebra.commSemiringTopologicalClosure) is not reducible (see e.g [Subalgebra.commRingTopologicalClosure](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Algebra.html#Subalgebra.commRingTopologicalClosure) for comparison). Would it make sense to explicitly override the `toSemiring` field to make sure all data is easily reducible to what it should be?
oh, I think those should just be marked `abbrev` instead. I'll make that change later.
I've done this in #18700 (along with other things)

```suggestion
/-- The `elemental` star subalgebra generated by a normal element is commutative. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: rename `elementalStarAlgebra` and parallelize API
